title: Semantic Versioning Spec
description: Terms and schemes, eg. Major, minor et al

flashcards.question: Given a version number 2.728.0 (as in "aws-sdk": "^2.728.0"), what is the 2 referred to as?
Given a version number 2.728.0 (as in "aws-sdk": "^2.728.0"), what is the 728 referred to as?
Given a version number 2.728.0 (as in "aws-sdk": "^2.728.0"), what is the 0 referred to as?
When does the Major version number get incremented?
flashcards.answer: When you make incompatible API changes.

flashcards.question: When does the Minor version get incremented?
flashcards.answer: When you add functionality in a backwards compatible manner.

flashcards.question: When does the Patch version get incremented?
flashcards.answer: When you make backwards compatible bug fixes.

flashcards.question: What does ~ (a tilde) preceding a version number mean?
flashcards.answer: Update all future patch versions, without incrementing the minor version. eg. ~1.2.3 will use releases from 1.2.3 to <1.3.0.

flashcards.question: What does ^ (a caret) preceding a version number mean?
flashcards.answer: Update all future minor/patch versions, without incrementing the major version. eg. ^2.3.4 will use releases from 2.3.4 to <3.0.0.
